summary: They reported that nails, screws, and pieces of iron ingested by cattle were often encased in a dense fibrous capsule with the original object wholly or partially corroded
reference: Smith, H.A. & Jones, T.C. (1957). Veterinary Pathology. Philadelphia: Lea and Febiger [in Walker, M.H. & Alexander, C.G. (1974). Jorunal of Fish Biology, 6(6), 759-761]
